pageContext.description: The dagger-blade is almost precisely identical with that from Arreton Down, but is lighter and not so thick at the middle. Both rivet-holes and one rivet remain; the point has been broken off, but appears to have been intact when the published account was written, and if restored the measurements there given would exactly tally with those of this specimen.
pageContext.associations: Found 8 inches below the surface, and 6 inches above burnt human bones.
pageContext.publications: Wilkins, Kell, & Locke, in Journ. Brit. Arch. Ass., XVI (1860), 253-261, Plate 20.
pageContext.site: England,Hampshire,Isle of Wight,Bowcombe,Bowcombe Down,Found in a large barrow in May 1859
pageContext.toSearch: Bowcombe, Newport, Isle Of Wight Po30, UK
